title: Scale: Harmonic in A# (Mode: Ultra locrian, Shape: D)
content:
## Harmonic Scale in A# (Mode: Ultra Locrian)

The Harmonic scale in A# refers to the A# Harmonic Minor scale, starting on the note A# and following the interval pattern specific to this scale. When played in the Ultra Locrian mode, it gives a tense and dissonant sound due to its unique combination of notes. In this mode, the scale highlights the flattened second (B), flattened third (C#), flattened fourth (D), flattened fifth (E), flattened sixth (F#), and double-flattened seventh (G#) notes, along with the natural seventh (A#). This exotic scale can evoke a mysterious and suspenseful atmosphere in music.

## Musical Flavor and Genre

The Harmonic scale in A# being used in the Ultra Locrian mode is often associated with genres like jazz fusion, metal, and progressive rock due to its complex and dark sound. It adds an edgy and progressive flavor to compositions, allowing for creative and avant-garde explorations in musical arrangements.
